title: The WALKING DEAD Premiere
body_text:
The mega-hit
AMC
show, the long-running battles of
ECD
, a combination of the two? Hardly! Contrary to the computer animations, stunt mannequins, and costume designs frequently seen on the
AMC
's "Walking Dead",
ECD
's same-named presentation was as non-fiction as its participants. No actors or doubles here and our blood is real.
BACKGROUND INFORMATION
Each 2013 date was carefully selected last November in preparation and anticipation for the massive
DODGEBOWL 200
slated for August 2013. A detailed schedule was made available to every
ECD
competitor, past and present. WALKING DEAD was the inaugural event in the line-up.
FEATURED MATCH
In setting the scene, numerically the rivaling squads were quite lopsided. For instance, the deemed EAST featured four full-time combatants: Wolf, K. Adams, Pierce, and Tronolone. The WEST had a little extra ammunition in Katz, Megill, Oberto, Cornero, Brummell, and K. Fitzpatrick. As you'll notice, the head count was irrelevant - the series of battles told the true tale.
The first eight - yes, 8 - rounds, contested under classic two-team rules, were equally divided between the factions. Neither team was able to pull off the victory on court east until the majority-rules vote ushered in the physical Prison Ball melee. From there, the EAST group mightily grabbed the next five games to seal the deal.
The EAST defeated The WEST, 9 - 4
WEST: Games 1, 3, 5, 7
EAST: Games 2, 4, 6, 8, 9*, 10*, 11*, 12*, 13*
* = Prison Ball
In a special post-war confrontation, a two-vs-two couples brawl broke out pitting the self-proclaimed "Mr. & Mrs. WrestleMania" John Tronolone and Valerie Winston against the nicknamed "Mr. & Mrs. Never-Going-To WrestleMania" Zach Katz and Alex Brummell. Safe the say it wasn't the finest athletic display especially after the preceding - and blood-thirsty - conflict. But in the end, the WrestleMania husband and wife narrowly prevailed to call a halt to the blockbuster WALKING DEAD premiere.
ONLINE EXCLUSIVE!
WALKING DEAD became the third consecutive
ECD
event to witness 10 or more games played. The preceding THANKSKILLING held 11 rounds and OCTOBERFEST actually broke the record with 18.
Only twice in history has such occurred:
ECD
39, XL, and 41
(10, 10, 11 games)
in May 2006;
ECD
LIX, LX, and LXI
(16, 11, 10 games)
in October 2006.
FOLLOW-UP STATISTICS
◘ WALKING DEAD featured
fourteen (14)
total participants comprised of 9 men and 5 women. No new players were recorded in the attendance.
◘ It was the astronomical 196th event held within the Tronolone Years of
ECD
en route to #200 in August 2013.
◘ Wall High School was the host venue for the second consecutive outing; the courts' lengthy reconstruction was finally completed during the sport's winter intermission.
◘ Rounding out the event roster was Ryan Letsche, Ashley Hoppe, and Alysha Kelly. Spectators included Zack Berghoff and Jason Teitelbaum.
What's With These "Ws"?
WINTERBALL, WALL BRAWL, WORLD TOUR, WARRIORS, WALKING DEAD, and even the forthcoming WINNER TAKE WALL .. something's up with that Writer.
Do you bleed WALL Red?
Are you ice cold ALL Blue?
Represent with pride and honor April 27.
body_html:
The mega-hit AMC show, the long-running battles of ECD, a combination of the two? Hardly! Contrary to the computer animations, stunt mannequins, and costume designs frequently seen on the AMC's "Walking Dead", ECD's same-named presentation was as non-fiction as its participants. No actors or doubles here and our blood is real.

BACKGROUND INFORMATION
Each 2013 date was carefully selected last November in preparation and anticipation for the massive DODGEBOWL 200 slated for August 2013. A detailed schedule was made available to every ECD competitor, past and present. WALKING DEAD was the inaugural event in the line-up.

FEATURED MATCH
In setting the scene, numerically the rivaling squads were quite lopsided. For instance, the deemed EAST featured four full-time combatants: Wolf, K. Adams, Pierce, and Tronolone. The WEST had a little extra ammunition in Katz, Megill, Oberto, Cornero, Brummell, and K. Fitzpatrick. As you'll notice, the head count was irrelevant - the series of battles told the true tale.

The first eight - yes, 8 - rounds, contested under classic two-team rules, were equally divided between the factions. Neither team was able to pull off the victory on court east until the majority-rules vote ushered in the physical Prison Ball melee. From there, the EAST group mightily grabbed the next five games to seal the deal.

The EAST defeated The WEST, 9 - 4
WEST: Games 1, 3, 5, 7
EAST: Games 2, 4, 6, 8, 9*, 10*, 11*, 12*, 13*
* = Prison Ball

In a special post-war confrontation, a two-vs-two couples brawl broke out pitting the self-proclaimed "Mr. & Mrs. WrestleMania" John Tronolone and Valerie Winston against the nicknamed "Mr. & Mrs. Never-Going-To WrestleMania" Zach Katz and Alex Brummell. Safe the say it wasn't the finest athletic display especially after the preceding - and blood-thirsty - conflict. But in the end, the WrestleMania husband and wife narrowly prevailed to call a halt to the blockbuster WALKING DEAD premiere.

ONLINE EXCLUSIVE!
WALKING DEAD became the third consecutive ECD event to witness 10 or more games played. The preceding THANKSKILLING held 11 rounds and OCTOBERFEST actually broke the record with 18.

Only twice in history has such occurred: ECD 39, XL, and 41 (10, 10, 11 games) in May 2006; ECD LIX, LX, and LXI (16, 11, 10 games) in October 2006.

FOLLOW-UP STATISTICS
◘ WALKING DEAD featured fourteen (14) total participants comprised of 9 men and 5 women. No new players were recorded in the attendance.
◘ It was the astronomical 196th event held within the Tronolone Years of ECD en route to #200 in August 2013.
◘ Wall High School was the host venue for the second consecutive outing; the courts' lengthy reconstruction was finally completed during the sport's winter intermission.
◘ Rounding out the event roster was Ryan Letsche, Ashley Hoppe, and Alysha Kelly. Spectators included Zack Berghoff and Jason Teitelbaum.

What's With These "Ws"?
WINTERBALL, WALL BRAWL, WORLD TOUR, WARRIORS, WALKING DEAD, and even the forthcoming WINNER TAKE WALL .. something's up with that Writer.



Do you bleed WALL Red?
Are you ice cold ALL Blue?

Represent with pride and honor April 27.
